reasons_to_visit.details: May often brings milder temperatures (average 15-17°C), increased sunshine, and long days to Limerick. Surrounding countryside and parks become lush and green.
Limerick's biggest festival typically takes place over the May Bank Holiday weekend. Expect street performers, food stalls, music, river-based events (like jet-ski stunts), and fireworks.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Ideal for Exploring Nearby Nature & History
reasons_to_visit.details: With better weather and long daylight, May is great for visiting Lough Gur, exploring the Ballyhoura Mountains (hiking/biking), or day trips to Bunratty Castle or even the coast.
Limerick city buzzes, especially during Riverfest. Enjoy the growing energy in pubs, cafes with outdoor seating, and along the riverside.
Outside the Bank Holiday/Riverfest weekend, May offers relatively fewer crowds than peak summer, potentially better accommodation value, and pleasant exploring conditions.
More outdoor activities become available, such as guided kayak tours on the Shannon or increased access/events at visitor sites.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: While improving, May weather can still be unpredictable with rain showers and wind possible. Packing layers and waterproofs is still recommended.
The May Bank Holiday weekend, especially if coinciding with Riverfest, sees huge crowds in the city centre, peak accommodation prices, and requires booking *far* in advance.
Grass pollen season begins, potentially affecting hay fever sufferers.
Tourist numbers rise noticeably towards summer. Don't expect empty attractions, especially on weekends, even outside the Bank Holiday.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of showers (average 70-80mm monthly), but often mixed with pleasant sunny spells. Days are long and bright.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, fleece/sweater, waterproof jacket. Comfortable walking shoes are vital. Sunscreen useful for sunny spells.

tourism_level.crowds: Extremely High during Riverfest/May Bank Holiday weekend. Moderate otherwise, increasing from April.
tourism_level.pricing: Peak rates during Riverfest/Bank Holiday. Shoulder season prices otherwise. Book accommodation very far ahead for the festival weekend.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Very festive and energetic during Riverfest. Pleasant spring buzz otherwise. City comes alive, especially outdoors.

events_holidays.name: Riverfest Limerick
events_holidays.date: Usually May Bank Holiday Weekend (First weekend in May - check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Limerick's largest annual festival featuring street food markets, music stages, street performers, river activities (jet skis, kayaking), the Great Limerick Run, and usually culminates in fireworks.
events_holidays.notes: Massive crowds, book accommodation months ahead. Check official Riverfest website for full schedule. Many events are free.

events_holidays.name: May Bank Holiday
events_holidays.description: Public holiday, coinciding with Riverfest makes it an exceptionally busy weekend in Limerick.
events_holidays.notes: Plan travel and bookings very carefully.

events_holidays.name: Great Limerick Run (Part of Riverfest)
events_holidays.description: Major running event (Marathon, Half Marathon, 6 Mile) attracting thousands of participants and spectators. Causes road closures.
events_holidays.notes: Significant traffic disruption in and around the city on this day.

unique_experiences.where: City Centre (Arthur's Quay, Howley's Quay, riverside, Potato Market)
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the free entertainment, sample diverse street food, watch river stunts, listen to live music, and soak up the carnival atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check the event schedule. Be prepared for large crowds. Bring cash for food stalls. Fireworks are usually Sunday night.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the iconic castle, perhaps slightly less crowded just before/after the main Riverfest peak.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book online if possible. Allow 2-3 hours.
unique_experiences.best_time: Weekday outside Riverfest, or early/late during festival

unique_experiences.description: Experience the bustling weekend market, even livelier with the onset of summer produce and good weather.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Saturday is the main day. Great place for food and local crafts.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk or Cycle the Riverside Paths
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the greening riverside landscape and increasing daylight on the accessible paths along the Shannon.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Paths are well-maintained. Bike rental options available.

weather.precipitation: Mix of sunshine and showers likely, potentially becoming warmer and more settled. Evenings remain bright very late.
weather.general_tips: Layers still advised, always include a waterproof. Sunscreen for bright spells. Comfortable shoes for walking.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate, steadily increasing towards June levels. Attractions noticeably busier than early spring, especially weekends.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season prices, potentially rising slightly. Booking ahead recommended.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Pleasant late spring/early summer feel. City is lively but generally less crowded than Riverfest or peak summer. Good balance for exploring.

events_holidays.name: Live Music Scene
events_holidays.description: Pubs and venues like Dolan's continue to offer regular live music as the season builds.

events_holidays.name: Local Community Events
events_holidays.description: Possibility of smaller local festivals, sporting events, or outdoor markets as summer approaches.

unique_experiences.description: Explore this significant archaeological landscape with stone circles, ancient dwellings, and visitor centre, now lush with spring growth.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Requires transport. Allow several hours to walk the sites and visit the centre. Wear good walking shoes.

unique_experiences.description: Join a guided kayak tour to see the city from the water as the weather becomes more suitable for water sports.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book tours in advance. Check weather suitability. Various operators available.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the castle and folk park, potentially less crowded than during the absolute peak season.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book online. Easily accessible by bus or car. Allow ample time.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the Victorian park coming into bloom and admire the surrounding Georgian architecture. Visit the City Gallery of Art.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Pleasant area for a relaxed stroll. Gallery is free.
